SEARCH
Module io.github.ascopes.jct
Package io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers

Interface JctFileManager

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable, Flushable, JavaFileManager, OptionChecker
All Known Implementing Classes:
JctFileManagerImpl
@API(since="0.0.1", status=EXPERIMENTAL) public interface JctFileManager extends JavaFileManager
Extension around a JavaFileManager that allows adding of PathWrapper objects to the manager.
Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Ashley Scopes

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces declared in interface javax.tools.JavaFileManager

    JavaFileManager.Location

  • Method Details

    • addPath

      void addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, PathWrapper path)
      Add a path to a given location.

      If the file manager is closed, this will raise an exception.

      Parameters:
      location - the location to use.
      path - the path to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the file manager is closed.

    • copyContainers

      void copyContainers(JavaFileManager.Location from, JavaFileManager.Location to)
      Copy all containers from the first location to the second location.
      Parameters:
      from - the first location.
      to - the second location.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the file manager is closed.

    • ensureEmptyLocationExists

      void ensureEmptyLocationExists(JavaFileManager.Location location)
      Register an empty container for the given location to indicate to the compiler that the feature exists, but has no configured paths.

      This is needed to coerce the behaviour for annotation processing in some cases.

      If the location already exists, then do not do anything.

      Parameters:
      location - the location to apply an empty container for.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the file manager is closed.

    • getPackageContainerGroup

      @Nullable @Nullable PackageContainerGroup getPackageContainerGroup(JavaFileManager.Location location)
      Get the container group for the given package-oriented location.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Parameters:
      location - the package oriented location.
      Returns:
      the container group, or null if one does not exist.

    • getPackageContainerGroups

      Collection<PackageContainerGroup> getPackageContainerGroups()
      Get a collection of all package container impl in this file manager.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Returns:
      the package container impl.

    • getModuleContainerGroup

      @Nullable @Nullable ModuleContainerGroup getModuleContainerGroup(JavaFileManager.Location location)
      Get the container group for the given module-oriented location.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Parameters:
      location - the module oriented location.
      Returns:
      the container group, or null if one does not exist.

    • getModuleContainerGroups

      Collection<ModuleContainerGroup> getModuleContainerGroups()
      Get a collection of all module container impl in this file manager.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Returns:
      the module container impl.

    • getOutputContainerGroup

      @Nullable @Nullable OutputContainerGroup getOutputContainerGroup(JavaFileManager.Location location)
      Get the container group for the given output-oriented location.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Parameters:
      location - the output oriented location.
      Returns:
      the container group, or null if one does not exist.

    • getOutputContainerGroups

      Collection<OutputContainerGroup> getOutputContainerGroups()
      Get a collection of all output container impl in this file manager.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Returns:
      the output container impl.

    • isClosed

      boolean isClosed()
      Determine if the JavaFileManager.close() method has been called on this file manager or not.

      This can safely be called on a closed file manager.

      Returns:
      false if the file manager is open, or true if it is closed.
